function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'malloc' to reach function 'main'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'fun'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i<10' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i<10' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition '*a!=0' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition '*a!=0' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<10' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition '*a!=0' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'a (line 3)' used after its definition?
Is variable 'b (line 3)' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'b (line 3)' live at the end of function 'fun'?
Is variable 'qa' live at the end of function 'fun'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'pb=qb=headb=malloc(sizeof(struct number));' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “pa=malloc(sizeof(struct number));”?
